title: Astronauts from Turkey, Sweden and Italy launch to space station on latest chartered flight
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. — Turkey’s first astronaut along with a Swede and Italian launched Thursday to the International Space Station on a chartered SpaceX flight.

title: Trump urges Supreme Court to allow him to stay on the ballot
description: The former president filed a brief asking the court to rule that the Constitution's 14th Amendment doesn't prevent him from appearing on Colorado's Republican primary ballot.

title: N.Y. midwife fined for giving 1,500 children homeopathic pellets instead of vaccines
description: A New York midwife has been fined for falsifying vaccine records and giving homeopathic pellets to 1,500 children instead of required vaccinations.

title: House Republicans set Hunter Biden deposition date for late February
description: The move is part of Republican-led efforts into an impeachment inquiry for President Joe Biden.

title: Capitol Police investigated more than 8,000 threats against lawmakers last year
description: U.S. Capitol Police investigated 8,008 threats against members of Congress last year, according to new case numbers released Thursday.

title: Meta is pouring money into the creation of human-level artificial intelligence, Zuckerberg says
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said Thursday he was shaking up his company’s efforts on artificial intelligence and pouring money into massive data centers.

title: Trans candidate facing disqualification now cleared to run despite omitting deadname
description: A transgender candidate vying for a seat in the Ohio House was cleared to run after her certification had been called into question for omitting her former name on qualifying petitions.

title: Madonna fans sue Material Girl and promoters after show begins 2 hours after ticketed start
description: Two Madonna fans filed a federal lawsuit against the iconic performer on Wednesday, accusing her of showing up hours late at a show last month and needlessly inconveniencing concertgoers.

title: New bipartisan bill would let moms in Congress vote by proxy after giving birth
description: Reps. Anna Paulina Luna and Sara Jacobs introduce legislation to allow new moms on Capitol Hill to vote by proxy.

title: Sundance’s latest slate of queer films adds to its rich legacy of shaping LGBTQ culture
description: Iconic queer films like “The Times of Harvey Milk” and “Go Fish” and new titles including “Layla” and “Desire Lines” will screen at Sundance's 40th edition.

title: Netanyahu's opposition to Palestinian state could complicate Senate aid package
description: WASHINGTON — Senate Democrats aggressively pushed back Thursday after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he has informed the U.S. that he opposes the creation of a Palestinian state at the conclusion of the war in Gaza.

title: Proposed Oklahoma bill would single out Hispanic gang members as 'terrorists'
description: An Oklahoma bill has stirred controversy in the state Legislature for seeking to label Hispanic people, in particular, who may be gang members, as terrorists.

title: Lululemon's Lunar New Year ad with Michelle Yeoh comes under scrutiny after founder’s anti-diversity comments
description: After the company’s founder shared negative comments on “diversity and inclusion,” Lululemon’s Lunar New Year ad featuring Michelle Yeoh is facing criticism online.

title: Doja Cat's brother allegedly 'knocked out' her teeth, her mother says in restraining order petition
description: Doja Cat was allegedly physically and verbally abused by her older brother, the singer’s mother said in a petition seeking a restraining order.

title: Barking dog helps rescue owner who fell nearly 200 feet off Hawaii hiking trail
description: A hiker who fell 200 feet down a steep slope off a marked trail in Hawaii was found and rescued thanks in large part to her barking dog.

title: Judge sets hearing on Trump co-defendant's misconduct allegations against Georgia DA Fani Willis
description: The judge in Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis's election interference case against Donald Trump and others has set a hearing date on misconduct allegations against the district attorney.

title: Long Covid explanation in new study possibly paves way for tests and treatments
description: Scientists identified a persistent change among people with long Covid that indicates part of their immune system may remain on high alert for months after infection.

title: Purina says its pet food is safe as allegations about sick animals multiply on social media
description: Allegations that some Purina pet food has sickened cats and dogs are circulating on social media, but Purina says there are no issues with its products.

title: Judge in Trump election interference case declines to hold special counsel Jack Smith in contempt
description: WASHINGTON — The judge overseeing the federal election interference case against former President Donald Trump has denied his request to hold special counsel Jack Smith and his office in contempt. Earlier this month, attorneys for Trump asked U.S.

title: Fannie Mae analysts expect mortgage rates to fall below 6% this year
description: After reaching a post-pandemic high of 7.8% last fall, the average 30-year mortgage rate is now expected to end the year below 6%, according to analysts at Fannie Mae.

title: Spelman College to receive $100 million, largest single donation to an HBCU
description: Spelman College in Atlanta will receive the largest single financial donation ever made to a historically Black college or university, the school announced on Thursday.

title: Ariana DeBose solves conflict from space in new ‘I.S.S.’ movie
description: In the sci-fi thriller ‘I.S.S.’, Afro Latina actor Ariana DeBose plays an astronaut at the International Space Station who has to grapple with a terrible event on Earth.

title: Suspect arrested in death of prominent N.Y. art dealer who was stabbed 18 times in Brazil
description: A suspect was arrested in the brutal killing in Brazil of an American art dealer who was the co-owner of a prominent gallery in Manhattan, police said Thursday.

title: In Gaza's collapsing health system, doctors preside over deaths that should be preventable
description: Gaza's hospitals are on the brink of collapsing, and people are dying preventable deaths from simple injuries and chronic diseases

title: Congress set to vote to prevent a government shutdown one day before deadline
description: Congress will vote to avoid a government shutdown on Thursday, one day before the deadline.

title: Snoop Dogg's 24-year-old daughter says she suffered a severe stroke
description: Snoop Dogg’s 24-year-old daughter, Cori Broadus, shared on social media early Thursday morning that she suffered a "severe stroke."

title: More than 60M people under winter weather alerts as snow and ice still blanket much of the U.S.
description: At least 66 million people were under winter weather alerts Thursday, as dangerously cold and icy conditions continue to pose risks — including in Oregon, where three people were killed by a power line downed by the weather.

title: A Burt's Bees, Hidden Valley Ranch lip balm collaboration has already sold out
description: If you were hoping to snatch a unique, sports bar-inspired flavor in your lip balm, you'll now have to wait.

title: Trump, awaiting ruling, says presidents must have 'complete and total' immunity
description: As former President Donald Trump awaits a ruling from a federal appeals court on his broad claim of presidential immunity, he said early Thursday that a U.S. president "must have complete and total presidential immunity."

title: NBA player Josh Giddey won't face charges following allegations he had an inappropriate relationship with minor
description: Oklahoma City Thunder guard Josh Giddey won't face charges following allegations he had an inappropriate relationship with a minor, Newport Beach police said.

title: More evidence suggests a multivitamin may help slow memory loss
description: A daily multivitamin may help protect against memory loss in oldest adults, according to a new study. The multivitamin slowed cognitive aging by about two years.

title: Instagram will use 'nudges' to start suggesting teens log off at night
description: Meta announced a new "nighttime nudges" feature that will prompt teenagers to close Instagram during late-night hours.

title: Taraji P. Henson says it's 'not fair' the narrative has turned away from 'The Color Purple'
description: Taraji P. Henson is ready for the narrative surrounding “The Color Purple” to change.

title: Massachusetts man sentenced to life with possibility of parole in racist road rage killing
description: Massachusetts man Dean Kapsalis was sentenced to life in prison for killing Henry Tapia.   Investigators found that after an argument, Kapsalis shouted a racial slur and then hit Tapia with his pickup as he drove off.

title: Richard Simmons says he never gave permission for Pauly Shore movie about his life
description: Fitness icon Richard Simmons is distancing himself from a new biopic about his life starring actor and comedian Pauly Shore.

title: Florida GOP lawmakers seek to ban rainbow flags in schools, saying they’re bad for students
description: A bill advanced by Florida Republicans on Wednesday would ban teachers and other government employees from displaying a rainbow Pride flag.

title: Inside the effort to create a far-reaching U.S.-Saudi-Israeli pact to end the war
description: The U.S. and Saudi Arabia are pushing a broad plan, but a key issue is the creation of a Palestinian state, a step many Israelis are hesitant to take after Hamas' Oct. 7 attack.

title: 'Red, White & Royal Blue' author Casey McQuiston says next novel is their 'spiciest'
description: "Red, White & Royal Blue" author Casey McQuiston's third adult novel, “The Pairing,” brought them on a culinary tour of Europe.

title: 'We had to work through a few things' during Schwarzenegger stop, Munich official says
description: Actor and former politician Arnold Schwarzenegger was checked by customs officials at Munich Airport and detained for a period of time, a customs officer said.

title: Post Malone to sing 'America the Beautiful' at Super Bowl; Reba McEntire, Andra Day to also perform
description: Post Malone will sing "America the Beautiful," Reba McEntire the national anthem and Andra Day "Lift Every Voice and Sing" during the pre-game for Super Bowl LVIII in Las Vegas, the NFL announced.

title: Monterey Park ballroom shooting hero says city's 'golden bubble' has burst, calls for gun control
description: One year after a mass gunman opened fire at a C.A. ballroom, Brandon Tsay, the man who disarmed him, says his community is still grappling with what happened.

title: Britain's Prince William visits his wife, Kate, in the hospital after her abdominal surgery
description: Prince William visited his wife Kate Thursday in a London hospital, where she is recovering after abdominal surgery.

title: EV drivers wrestle with cold weather sapping their battery range
description: Electric vehicles' batteries don’t work as efficiently in the cold, and regulating cabin temperature can gobble up a lot of power, depending on a model's HVAC.

title: Disinformation poses an unprecedented threat in 2024 — and the U.S. is less ready than ever
description: Disinformation poses an unprecedented threat to democracy as the 2024 U.S. presidential election approaches, according to researchers and political scientists.

title: Person of interest in 5 stabbings over 9 days in Queens is in custody, NYPD says
description: A person of interest in a string of unprovoked stabbings in Queens was taken into custody, New York City police said Wednesday.

title: E. Jean Carroll is back on the witness stand — this time without Trump in the room
description: The former president will be attending funeral services for his mother-in-law in Florida when Carroll testifies for a second day in her defamation case against Trump.

title: Missouri abortion rights groups launch effort to place constitutional amendment on the 2024 ballot
description: Reproductive rights advocates launched an effort to advance an amendment that would enshrine abortion rights in the Missouri Constitution ahead of the 2024 election.

title: Pakistan strikes Iran and Arnold Schwarzenegger faces criminal proceedings : Morning Rundown
description: Donald Trump, E. Jean Carroll, Jim Irsay, Uvalde Texas, Robb Elementary shooting, Pakistan, Iran, Elise Stefanik, Panera Bread Charged Lemonade, Dejan Milojević

title: Long-awaited DOJ report on Uvalde mass shooting to be released Thursday
description: The DOJ is releasing a report on what went wrong with law enforcement officers’ response to the mass shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas.

title: State Democrats are leading on abortion policy. D.C. Democrats don’t want to get left behind.
description: Democrats are marking the 51st anniversary of Roe v. Wade with an all-out campaign — with abortion rights set to help determine who wins the 2024 election.

title: White House criticizes House Republican impeachment push against DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas
description: The White House slammed an effort to impeach Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas in the House as “unconstitutional,” charging that the push is part of a broader movement by Republicans to “disregard” democratic checks and balances.

title: Why Trump is likely to have more leeway for outbursts in criminal trials
description: The former president's heated exchange with a federal judge this week comes as trial proceedings loom in four criminal cases ahead of the 2024 election.

title: Pakistan carries out retaliatory strikes in Iran
description: Pakistan carries out retaliatory strikes in Iran

title: In a first for Singapore, cabinet minister is charged with corruption
description: Singapore’s transport minister S Iswaran has resigned after he was formally informed of corruption and other charges by the country’s anti-graft agency.

title: 9-year-old Florida boy killed after crawling under moving school bus
description: A 9-year-old Florida boy died after he crawled under a moving school bus that had just dropped him off at his stop, the state highway patrol said.

title: U.S. appeals court blocks Texas law that could ban or restrict library books
description: A federal appeals court on Wednesday blocked a Texas law that would require ratings from booksellers that deal with school libraries, agreeing with a lower court that found it unconstitutional.

title: Explosion at a fireworks factory in rural Thailand kills about 20 people
description: An explosion at a fireworks factory in central Thailand killed about 20 people on Wednesday, according to provincial officials.

title: Texas refuses to comply with Biden administration's cease-and-desist letter about border access
description: The Department of Homeland Security had directed the state to stop blocking the U.S. Border Patrol’s access to roughly 2½ miles of the U.S.-Mexico border.

title: Missouri man imprisoned for 27 years on wrongful conviction sues St. Louis and police
description: A Missouri man who spent nearly 28 years in prison until a judge determined he was wrongfully convicted has sued, alleging that St. Louis police framed him.

title: Frigid winter weather causes challenges for electric vehicle owners
description: In Chicago, brutal temperatures are causing growing frustrations for EV drivers. The lithium batteries can drain more quickly in cold temperatures, leading to long lines and wait times at charging stations. NBC News’ Adrienne Broaddus reports on the impact the colder weather is having on the vehicles.

title: Palestinian American college student paralyzed in Vermont shooting speaks out for the first time
description: College students Hisham Awartani, Kinnan Abdalhamid and Tahseen Ahmed were shot in Burlington, Vermont, in November. Sharing his story for the first time, Awartani told NBC News' Tom Llamas he remembers walking down the street when a man came down from his porch and pulled out a pistol. Awartani is now paralyzed. He says he's grateful for the medical care he's received in the U.S. but worries about people in Gaza unable to get the same care.

title: Colts owner Jim Irsay found unresponsive and struggling to breathe last month, police report says
description: Police administered Narcan to Indianapolis Colts owner Jim Irsay to help revive him after he was found at his home last month breathing abnormally and with bluish skin, authorities said.

title: White House apologizes to Asa Hutchinson after snarky DNC statement
description: A Biden adviser said no one at the Democratic National Committee would lose their job over the statement, chalking it up to a mistake made in a highly charged campaign season.
